intro: Haplophyllum rubellulum, commonly known as the red-stemmed hollyhock, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters and thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are tubular and often have a distinctive red or purple coloration, making it a visually striking addition to gardens. Haplophyllum rubellulum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
